oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Nashville's lower Broad: the street that music made - 2004-09-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion about Nashville's lower Broadway on September 17, 2004 from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. Moderated by Michael Gray.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Rouda; Gary Bennett; Hank Cochran; Lois Shepherd; John Shepherd;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Program begins in progress. Opening comments by Michael Gray. Introduction of panel participants. Hank Cochran talks about his early years, hooking up with Eddie Cochran and then coming to Nashville -- Being introduced to Tootsie Bess and how he first got to Broadway -- Helping Willie Nelson get a publishing contract -- Gary Bennett talks about his early years and how he ended up on Broadway at Robert's Western Wear -- Bennett meeting Chuck Mead -- John Shepherd talks about his early years and how he ended up in Nashville and on to the music scene on Broadway -- Lois Shepherd talks about her early years and meeting John Shepherd and coming back to Nashville -- Bill Rouda talks about his early years and how he found himself in Nashville -- Rouda's inspiration for taking photographs of lower broad -- Story of Lucinda Williams seeing Greg Garing and others at Tootsie's Orchid Lounge -- Rouda talks about his inspiration for his photo book -- End of tape one.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rouda, Bill; Bennett, Gary; Cochran, Hank; Shepherd, John; Shepherd, Lois; Broadway (Tenn.); Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
